peopleAlsoAsk.question: When did monotremes diverge from therians?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: On the basis of our data sets, the time of divergence between Monotremata and Theria was estimated at 231–217 MYA and between Marsupialia and Eutheria at 193–186 MYA.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Platypus Is in Its Place: Nuclear Genes and Indels Confirm the Sister ...

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the most recent ancestor of mammals?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Final Answer: The most recent ancestor of existing mammals is Therapsid.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Which amongst the following is the most recent ancestor of existing ma

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Did the prototherian monotremes and therian marsupials and eutherians mammals groups diverge from each other before the Cretaceous period?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The mammalian timetree indicates that monotremes diverged from the- rians in the late Triassic, ~220 million years ago (Ma), and that marsupials and eutherians diverged ~176 Ma, between the early and middle Jurassic.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Mammals (Mammalia)

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the common ancestor of Theria?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Mammalia. Mammalia is defined as the most recent common ancestor of Monotremata and Theria (marsupials plus placentals), and all of that ancestor's descendants. Mammalia is diagnosed by a large number of anatomical and physiological features, including the presence of mammary glands and a unique jaw joint.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the 4 superorders of placental mammals?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: At the interordinal level, molecular data consistently resolve extant placental groups into four 'superorders': Afrotheria, Xenarthra, Laurasiatheria and Euarchontoglires (the latter two comprising Boreoeutheria).
peopleAlsoAsk.title: A higher-level MRP supertree of placental mammals - PMC

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the mammalian supertree?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The mammalian supertree is a comprehensive phylogenetic tree that includes all known species of mammals.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What is the mammalian supertree? | CK-12 Foundation

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the 5 differences between mammals and non-mammals?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Some animals don't stay with their young at all, and the young are on their own. 5. The characteristics that make a mammal a mammal include pres- ence of hair or fur, warm-blooded, young born alive, mammary glands and complex brain. 5) it has a larger and more complex brain than any of the other animal groups.
